moves.1. e4: I start out with the King Pawn Opening.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc: The black knight is traded for my bishop.
moves.5. O-O: Castling - and threatening the d-pawn. Note that 6. Nxe5 is not stopped by 6. ... Qd4 7. Nf3 Qxe4 Re1 and the queen is dead.
moves.5... Bg4: Pinned. This haunts me over time.
moves.6. h3 Bh5 7. d3 h6 8. Be3 c5 9. Nc3: I think Nbd2 was better, so I can move my queen out of the pin without having a ruined kingside

gameName: OTB 11: OTB tournament II game II - Ruy Lopez Exchange
opening: Ruy Lopez (C69), exchange variation, Alapin gambit
